TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed VerifyResult extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the result of a certificate or signature verification.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the VerifyResult enumeration.
[!code-vb[PackageDigitalSignature#PackageDigSigValidate](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/packagedigitalsignature/packagedigitalsignature.vb#packagedigsigvalidate)] [!code-cs[PackageDigitalSignature#PackageDigSigValidate](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/PackageDigitalSignature/PackageDigitalSignature.cs#packagedigsigvalidate)]
For the complete sample, see [Creating a Package with a Digital Signature Sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=159966).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.Packaging.VerifyResult CertificateRequired = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The X.509 certificate is not available to verify the signature.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.Packaging.VerifyResult InvalidCertificate = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The X.509 certificate is not valid.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.Packaging.VerifyResult InvalidSignature = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype System.IO.Packaging.VerifyResult NotSigned = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The specified package or part has no signature.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.Packaging.VerifyResult ReferenceNotFound = int32(4)

Docs.summary: A reference relationship to the signature was not found.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.Packaging.VerifyResult Success = int32(0)
